titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Willy Arnheim papers, 1962-1985 MS2162
titlestmt.author: Special Collections Research Center, The George Washington University

publicationstmt.publisher: Special Collections Research Center, The George Washington University

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2022-01-11 11:40:26 -0500.

repository.corpname: Special Collections Research Center, The George Washington University

did.abstract: Collection contains reports, photographs, slides, correspondence, and clippings related to the restoration of the West Front of the United States Capitol. The material dates from 1962 to 1985. The reports, images, and correspondence deal with the technical issues involved in the restoration, whereas the clippings are mainly concerned with the political debates surrounding the proposed expansion and restoration of the building.

prefercite.head: Preferred citation
prefercite.p: Willy Arnheim papers, Special Collections Research Center, The George Washington University.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: The collection was donated by Alaine Arnheim in 1988.

userestrict.head: Restrictions on Use
userestrict.p: Some material may be copyrighted or restricted. It is the patron's obligation to determine and satisfy copyright or other case restrictions when publishing or otherwise distributing materials found in the collections.

bioghist.head: Historical or Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Willy Arnheim (1911-1990) was an expert in stone construction techniques, and worked as a consultant for the restoration of several stone buildings in Washington, D.C., including the United States Capitol, Smithsonian Institution, and National Gallery of Art. Arnheim was born in 1911 in Sweden, and immigrated to the United States in 1928. He worked as a stone mason and union organizer before serving as construction superintendent on over 100 buildings in the Washington, D.C. area and around the country. Arnheim died in 1990.

scopecontent.head: Collection Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: This collection contains reports, photographs, slides, correspondence, and clippings related to the restoration of the West Front of the United States Capitol. The material dates from 1962 to 1985. The reports, images, and correspondence deal with the technical issues involved in the restoration, whereas the clippings are mainly concerned with the political debates surrounding the proposed expansion and restoration of the building. Note that in most cases the clippings have been discarded and replaced with lists of the articles' titles, sources, and dates. Some items, namely Preliminary Plans and Estimates of Cost for the Extension of the West Central Front of the Capitol (1967), United States Capitol: Restoration of the West Central Front: Feasibility and Cost Study (January 1971), and United States Capitol: The Restoration of West Central Facade: Preparation of Alternative Designs: Report (March 1978), have been separated from this collection and are now kept in the book collection.

did.unittitle: "Restoration of Historic Buildings Constructed with Natural Stone"
